channel.title: Board / Category
channel.description:
Hey.. again. Lol.
Anywho, I'm working on creating a very simple forum script (it's just for fun lol.).
I'm stumped again - I know, i'm not the smartest. Here is how my category database is set up:
[code]CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `cat` ( `id` int(10) NOT NULL auto_increment, `catname` varchar(100) default NULL, `catdesc` varchar(250) default NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`) ) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 AUTO_INCREMENT=2 ;[/code]
I'm just wondering about how I could go about to make it so that if you add a board to it, it will go under the appropriate category... Lol, i'm trying to think on explaining this.. Uhh. Basically if I click the 'Add Board' for category 1 then I want it to add the board to that category..
and then list it under that category..

item.title: Board / Category
item.dc:creator: @iKolli iKolli`
item.description:
@iKolli wrote:

Yeah - well, I just needed something to do for fun

I guess I’ll work on that some more when I learn more php.

What’s some more ideas for something to code?

Read full topic

item.title: Board / Category
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Yeah, if you don’t know anything about functions, you will not be able to make … anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Board / Category
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

I suggest you learn php with more simple things before you create something like that, imo.

Learn more about functions, statements, etc…

Read full topic
